intro: Cliffortia natalensis, commonly known as the Natal Cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is well adapted to harsh, sunny environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces pods that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
